course_title: Topics: Historical Analysis: Resistance in Afro-Latin Amer.
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 14 / Seats Avail: 11Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as LACS 270 1)
People of African descent have been present in Latin America for as long as Europeans have, and they continue to be an important part of the racial composition of the region. This course will explore the forms of resistance African people and their descendants have used across Latin America history from the early colonial period through present day. By tracing the complicated history of race and ethnicity from colonial times to now, students will gain a greater understanding of the African presence in Latin America and the ways in which people of African descent have sought upward mobility and challenged systems of exploitation, oppression, and disenfranchisement.
course_description: An introductory course on the nature and methods of history. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
schedule_location: MW 5:30pm-6:45pm in Math & Science Center - W307C
